alert.note: Alert for Hickman (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 26 at 12:42PM CST until January 29 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River At Centerville affecting Hickman County. For the Duck River...including Centerville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Duck River at Centerville. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Water begins to overflow the banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM CST Friday the stage was 17.1 feet and rising. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.1 feet tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday evening at 600 PM CST.
